alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 20 at 6:04PM CST until January 21 at 9:25AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water is flowing over portions of Hood Road and extensive agricultural flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 PM CST Thursday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 12.4 feet and begin rising again early Saturday morning. It will rise to 12.7 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 01/25/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
